statements: UPDATE CustomerSupport SET customer_name='John Doe', purchase_history='Updated purchase history' WHERE customer_id=123;
UPDATE CustomerSupport SET purchase_history='New purchase information', customer_preferences='{
updated_preference1':'value1', 'updated_preference2':'value2'}' WHERE customer_id=456;
UPDATE CustomerSupport SET customer_preferences = '{"notification": "email", "language": "en"}', purchase_history = 'Updated purchase history' WHERE customer_id = 101
UPDATE CustomerSupport SET customer_name = 'Alice Smith', purchase_history = 'Additional purchase details', customer_preferences = '{"notification": "SMS", "language": "fr"}' WHERE customer_id = 102
UPDATE customer_histories SET interaction_type = 'Feedback' WHERE customer_id = 12345;
UPDATE customer_preferences SET preferred_language = 'Spanish', email_notifications = true WHERE customer_id = 54321;
UPDATE customer_histories SET interaction_type = 'Purchase', interaction_details = 'Customer bought a new product' WHERE customer_id = 123
UPDATE customer_preferences SET preferred_language = 'Spanish', preferred_time_zone = 'CET', email_notifications = FALSE WHERE customer_id = 456
UPDATE customer_histories SET history = 'New history entry' WHERE customer_id = 1;
UPDATE support_agents SET agent_email = 'newemail@example.com', agent_name = 'John Doe' WHERE agent_id = 2;
UPDATE customer_histories SET history = 'Updated history for customer 1' WHERE customer_id = 1;
UPDATE support_agents SET agent_email = 'new.email@example.com', agent_name = 'John Doe' WHERE agent_id = 3;
UPDATE CustomerHistory SET InteractionType='Purchase' WHERE CustomerID=1001;
UPDATE CustomerAgents SET AgentRole='Supervisor', AgentName='John Doe' WHERE AgentID=2005;
UPDATE CustomerAgents SET AgentRole = 'Supervisor' WHERE AgentID = 3;
UPDATE AgentInteractions SET InteractionType = 'New Inquiry', InteractionDetails = 'Customer requested information about new products' WHERE CustomerID = 5;
UPDATE customers SET customer_email = 'newemail@example.com' WHERE customer_id = 1;
UPDATE customer_preferences SET preference_value = 'updated value' WHERE preference_id = 2;
UPDATE customers SET customer_name = 'John Doe', customer_email = 'john.doe@example.com' WHERE customer_id = 1;
UPDATE customer_interactions SET interaction_date = '2022-11-25 15:30:00', interaction_type = 'Feedback', interaction_content = 'Great service provided to the customer' WHERE interaction_id = 1;
